title: Do squishy supports need mana regen runes?
body:
I was just wondering if its a good idea to use mana regen runes for support to stay in the lane much longer and keep spaming abilities.
I need advise... Please help (-.-)
SUPPORT FOREVER!

replies.body:
Mana Regen Runes definitely are viable on squishy supports but I'd add that I'd do it situationally. 

A range of high challenger supports run mana regen but usually it is limited to Janna, Nami and Lulu. It depends on how aggressive your playstyle is. 

If you're playing into a Leona Corki lane (or high burst magic damage in general) Id definitely be running magic resist.

However if you're laning against someone without high kill potential on you, mana regen will win out as you can out poke and sustain on these champs. 

Hope this helps!

At the end of the day, your play-style will determine what you should have on your rune pages and masteries.

If you like spamming spells and think you need mana regen, then build mana regen. 

You need to also keep in mind that when people discuss what LCS players or Challenger/Diamond players do, that their opponents play very differently from solo queue. Solo queue has it's own set of tactics and skills. So if an LCS player takes mana regen runes, it doesn't mean it's the best option for you.

In summary, trying and failing is the best way to perfect your rune pages to your needs.
I don't run it, but you can if you want to. I USED to run it on Nami and such but you just learn to conserve your mana, if you want Spellthief's gold, autos man.

There aren't many supports who have spammy abilities.

Unless we are talking out-of-meta supports, you shouldn't use it.

As a support main.
I personally don't see the point in mana regen over other runes.
You shouldn't need to spam abilities.
A good support will pick their times carefully and not use all of their mana.
I agree with you and thanks <3
